titles.title: Mäṣḥafä ʾIsayǝyyas “Book of Isaiah” / Mäṣḥafä mǝssale “Book of Proverbs” / Ṭǝbäbä Sälomon “Wisdom of Solomon” / Qalä Mäkbǝb “Word of Ecclesiastes” / Mäṣḥafä ʾIyob “Book of Job”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä ʾIsayǝyyas “Book of Isaiah” [Is.] (fols. 2ra-56vb) II) Mäṣḥafä mǝssale “Book of Proverbs” [Prov.] (fols. 57ra-101rb) II-1) Mǝssalǝyatä Sälomon “Proverbs of Solomon” (fols. 57ra-77vb) II-2) Tägśaṣä Sälomon “Admonition of Solomon” (fols. 77vb-82vab) III) Ṭǝbäbä Sälomon “Wisdom of Solomon” [Wis.] (fols. 82va-101rb) IV) Qalä Mäkbǝb “Word of Ecclesiastes” [Ecc.] (fols. 101rb-111ra) V) Mäṣḥafä ʾIyob, Book of Job [Job] (fols. 112ra-141ra)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor has been erased from the supplication formula on fol. 56vb. According to Additio 1, the Ms. was donated by ʾabba Gäbrä Krǝstos and his son ʾabba Gäbrä Mikaʾel.

txstates.txstate: The textblock is loosely attached to the boards. The spine cover is damaged at the top and the bottom edges. Two fols. were probably cut out from quire A. Fol. 111 is a half leaf.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, corni-form, small x, double sine wave with dots, criss cross).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, one pair close to the head and one pair close to the tail of the codex. Chains of endband stitches are visible in the upper part of the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(1; s.l.: 1, stub after 1/fol. 1r-v) — I(10/fols. 2r-11v) — II(10/fols. 12r-21v) — III(10/fols. 22r-31v) — IV(10/fols. 32r-41v) — V(10/fols. 42r-51v) — VI(10/fols. 52r-61v) — VII(10/fols. 62r-71v) — VIII(10/fols. 72r-81v) — IX(10/fols. 82r-91v) — X(10/fols. 92r-101v) — XI(10/fols. 102r-111v) — XII(10/fols. 112r-121v) — XIII(11; s.l.: 3, stub after 9/fols. 122r-132v) — XIV(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 133r-141v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Two groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I; a few lines (alternating with black a line) on the incipit page of Texts II-1 and V; two lines (alternating with black a line) of the incipit of Texts II-2, III and IV; two initial lines of the sections of Texts I and V; words kǝfǝl and mǝʿǝraf; part and chapter numbers; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

otherdetails.otherdetail: Text I is divided into parts (kǝfǝl) which are followed by a number. The numeration is not reliable and stops after fol. 34ra. Up to fol. 56ra, the scribe left blank spaces for rubricated numerals. Texts II-IV are divided into parts (kǝfǝl), but only at the beginning of Text II-1 they are followed by a number. Text V is divided into parts (kǝfǝl) and chapters (mǝʿǝraf) which are followed by numbers up to fol. 120rb.

additional.cont: Fol. 2r (upper margin): Donation note.
additional.add: Fol. 2r: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘአባ፡ ገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወወልዱ፡ አባ፡ ገብረ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወሀብነ፡ ለአቡነ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ደብረ፡ ዳሞ፡ ከመ፡ ይኵነነ፡ መርሐ፡ ለመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ኢትርስዑኑ፡ ዓቢይ፡ ወንዑስ፡ ደቂቀ፡ ዳሞ
additional.det: The note is written in a very crude hand. It states that the Ms. was donated to the Däbrä Dammo monastery by ʾabba Gäbrä Krǝstos and his son ʾabba Gäbrä Mikaʾel.

extras.extra: - The title of the Ms., መጻፋ አስያስ(?), is crudely written on the front board. - The title of the Ms., መፅሃፈ ኢሳያስ[sic], and the internal number of the monastic library (278) are written on fol. 1r. - The title of Text V, ዘኢዮብ, is written in the upper margin, in red, in the main hand. - Tämälläs-signs, in the shape of two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omissions, written in two different secondary hands, belong: fols. 8va l.17, 10ra l.8, 23rb l.10, 25ra l.16, 26rb l.5, 28ra l.26, 34rb l.2, 35rb l.6, 47va l.4, 54ra l.16, 57va l.11, 60va l.16, 61ra l.3, 61vb l.16, 63vb l.13, 64ra l.4, 64rb l.2, 65rb l.12, 67vb l.13, 68va l.18, 70ra l.10, 74ra l.17, 74rb l.15, 74vb l.20, 75va l.19, 77rb l.9, 77vb l.13, 78ra l.17, 113va l.5, 118rb l.2, 140vb l.14. - Omissions written interlineally and in the margins, in two different secondary hands: fols. 6r, 7r, 7va, 8rb, 8vb, 9r, 10vb, 11ra, 12va, 13va, 15rb, 16r, 16vb, 17r, 18rb, 19ra, 23vb, 25ra, 29ra, 29vb, 31va, 34r, 35va, 36ra, 39vb, 42va, 43rb, 54rb, 54vb, 57r, 57v, 58rb, 58vb, 59rb, 59v, 60rv, 61r, 64r, 64vb, 65rv, 66r, 70r, 75r, 76ra, 93va, 98r, 102va, 103ra, 113rb. - Corrections written over erasures and interlineally, in a secondary hand: fols. 3ra, 7rb, 11ra, 11va, 12va, 14va, 22ra, 25rb, 47rb, 57r, 64vb, 69vb, 77va, 78ra, 86ra, 117ra. - Correction indicated by thin lines above and below the word, occasionally with the correct text written interlineally, in two different secondary hands: fols. 3vb-4ra, 6rb, 13ra, 13va, 17vb, 18ra, 18va, 21va, 24rb, 25vb, 29ra, 34ra, 37rb, 39rb, 44va, 46va, 61va, 62vb, 63r, 68rb, 72rb, 73rb, 130rb, 140vb. - Commentaries in Gǝʿǝz and glosses written in the margins, in a secondary hand: fols. 5r, 7ra, 7vb, 8ra, 20ra, 37ra, 47va. - Erasures: fols. 15v, 38rb, 38va, 50ra, 53vb, 87ra. - A note or notes have been erased from fols. 111r-v, 141rb-vb. - Pen trials: fols. 1r. - Writing exercises: fols. 1rv, 141v. - Numerous scribbles throughout the Ms., in pencil.
